definition: lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: Printmaking is the process of making artworks by printing, normally on paper.
sentences.chinese: 版畫是製作過程藝術品印刷，通常是紙上談兵。

sentences.english: The other occasions for you to understand how to control emotion is basically talking about your pipe dreams.
sentences.chinese: 其餘任何時刻對於情緒控制的理解，都是紙上談兵。

sentences.english: I doubt we shall not get much nearer to the nature of love by mere talking.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們只是紙上談兵，那就不可能瞭解到愛之真諦。

sentences.english: " Otherwise one part person put forward "light is navel-gazing is equal to talk.
sentences.chinese: 另有一部分人提出“光是紙上談兵等於空談。

sentences.english: Don't just discuss your theories, test them, and test them today.
sentences.chinese: 不要再紙上談兵了，實驗它，而且今天就實驗。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to turn a blind eye to
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
